column4: Are there any plans to enable selinux extensions by default in the next ubuntu release, like fedora has done already?
do you really need selinux?
not sure but it sounds really sexy and "must have"
nonsense. selinux is something to be used by companies and stuff. no benefit for the simple user
doesn't a simple user want to be safe from online threats?
that is what firewalls are for, and iptables is perfect for thet job.
go here and look at the pic http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Selinux . are you a large company that needs policies and stuff?
it is definitely useless for the simple user
i dont know. i have used it once to recover some deleted photos from a CF card
killall gnome-panel
it is still blank
the panel is there but it does not have open windows listed?
correct
right click on an empty panel area and "add to panel" > "window selection" maybe (i am in greek and i dont know if its correct translation)
I have a window selectOR not selection...I tried it but it just added an x-chat icon to the bottom panel which is otherwise blank
let me make a new panel to find what it is
window list ??
that did it. They look a bit odd but yeah they are back
right click > add to panel > window list ??
yeah that worked
try to run apt-cdrom with the cdrom unmounted
had to trick it by mounting it in another tty just before hitting enter
